text: is there any way to remove the <http://f.HubSpotusercontent10.net/hubfs/hubid|f.HubSpotusercontent10.net/hubfs/hubid> and replace it with a custom path? <http://domain.com/file_path/|domain.com/file_path/>

Hey all - I know that the HubSpot chrome extension does this already but, call me petty, two clicks and sometimes… three clicks to bust cache is driving me up a wall. So I built a chrome extension that busts cache in  one click. Feel free to use it if you also dont like clicking two/three times to bust cache!

<https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/cache-buster/egiiajpiadpmbocfhbbbolhhnpgpfekn?hl=en&authuser=3>

<@U01P7C5P866> , go to the ‘File’, click ‘Details’. After the pop-up box opens, click on the drop down field where you see the URL. Change the URL, and Copy URL.

Then where you want to use it, choose ‘external page’ and paste that URL.
thank you but this situation has 3500 resource files from the previous website they want to match in HubSpot.  i think url redirect is the only option other than the default setting.

Update: Looks like im having troubles getting the extension to work properly. The local tests all worked fine and now that its packaged on the store it seems to be not showing any love. Same for you folks I imagine?
<@U01P7C5P866>, even in that case, it'll need a lot of manual effort.
